_description: Section guidance for Record Inspection. Keyed by sheet name, document_role::document_type, or document_role. Sheet-name keys provide category-specific analyst checklists.

what_to_look_for: Confirm the correct Account is linked (no personal test accounts, no duplicates)
Check Contract Type / Deal Type (e.g., CMA, CPA, Distribution, Publishing) matches the uploaded contract and internal notes
Validate Stage and Close Date are realistic: Closed–Won only when fully executed, Close Date matches execution/effective dates
Ensure key classifiers are set: deal subtype (catalog only vs frontline), primary artist/roster, territory/region flags
Confirm linkage to downstream records: Financial record present, Contract(s) attached, V2 Addons visible if relevant
common_failure_modes: Wrong or missing Contract Type, causing mis-routing or wrong workflows
Opportunity linked to the wrong Account (similar names, old imprint, holding companies)
Stage set to Closed–Won before execution, or never updated after signing
Close Date set to 'today' instead of matching the actual deal timeline
Missing linkage to Financial or Contracts objects — downstream tools can't find the deal
Notes or attachments describe a different deal than the structured fields

what_to_look_for: Verify the legal name of the artist/client/partner matches the most recent contract
Confirm Account Type / Role (artist, label, distributor, publisher, brand, internal entity)
Check core identity fields: country / primary operating territory, external IDs or internal IDs
Ensure the Account is the canonical record: no obvious duplicate accounts representing the same entity
Linked Contacts are the correct business reps (A&R, legal, finance)
common_failure_modes: Multiple accounts for the same artist/partner with slightly different spellings or punctuation
Old label/parent names used instead of current entity
Country / territory mismatched with the actual contract
Wrong Account Type (e.g., marking an artist as a label, or vice versa)
Orphaned Opportunities / Contracts not linked to the main Account
Contacts on the Account who are no longer relevant (old managers, ex-labels) but still appear as primary

what_to_look_for: Confirm financial terms match the governing contract(s): advances (amount, currency, recoupment), fees / rev-share or royalty percentages, minimum guarantees / caps / floors
Verify units and formats: percentages vs decimals (e.g., 0.3 vs 30%), currency codes vs symbols (USD, GBP, EUR)
Check term and payment structure: correct start/end dates, installment schedules match contract (upfront vs phased)
Ensure links to Opportunity, Account, Contracts are set and consistent
common_failure_modes: Percentages entered as decimals (or vice versa)
Wrong currency selected (e.g., USD instead of EUR)
Typo'd amounts (extra zero, missing zero)
Financial terms not updated after an amendment or restatement
Financial record exists but is not linked to the corresponding Opportunity/Contract
Advances or fees captured in notes only, not structured fields

what_to_look_for: Confirm the Schedule is linked to the correct parent Contract / Agreement
Check what the Schedule is defining: territories, term periods, services, obligations, options
Validate that effective dates and scopes align with the main agreement (no contradictory term/territory unless explicitly an override)
Ensure fields describing rights and obligations are clear enough to drive automation (e.g., 'WW excl. US' instead of 'global-ish')
Check consistency with existing system terminology for territories and right types
common_failure_modes: Schedule linked to the wrong contract (similar artist or deal)
Term/territory values that conflict with the main agreement but not clearly flagged
Overly vague descriptions that can't be used in automation: 'Standard rights', 'normal term'
Missing indication of whether this schedule is the first, a replacement, or a supplement
Schedules that should be catalog-type but are stored as generic schedules (and vice versa)

what_to_look_for: Verify each catalog row has the key identifiers: title, artist, ISRC/UPC, internal catalog ID
Confirm the Schedule Catalog is attached to the correct parent Contract / Opportunity / Account
Check that assets and territories match the intended scope: full catalog, subset, or termination subset
Look for indicators of partial supersession: only some assets listed as terminated or transferred
Ensure no obvious duplicates or conflicts with existing catalog schedules
common_failure_modes: Missing or inconsistent ISRC/UPC values
Same asset appearing in multiple schedules with different ownership/rights and no clear ordering
Schedule labeled 'full catalog' but obviously missing major releases
Catalog schedule not marked as new, updated, or termination schedule — hard to interpret
Schedule representing partial termination but not tagged as partial in the system

what_to_look_for: Confirm contract type is correctly classified: main agreement, amendment, termination, side letter, schedule, catalog schedule, work-for-hire, restatement
Check party names and roles: match the Account and any related Opportunities, no outdated or incorrect entity names
Validate key dates: Effective Date, Signature/Execution Date, Termination Date — consistent with Salesforce / HUB records
Confirm linkage: Contract is attached to the right Account, Opportunity, Financial, and Schedules
Identify whether this document replaces, modifies, or adds to previous documents; is full or partial (especially for terminations)
common_failure_modes: Mis-labeling documents (e.g., a side letter stored as an amendment, termination stored as standard amendment)
Missing or wrong Effective Date, causing timeline ordering issues
Contract uploaded but not connected to the relevant Opportunity/Account
New restatement not marked as the 'current' main agreement, leaving old ones incorrectly active
Partial terminations treated as full terminations in the system

what_to_look_for: Confirm each Addon is tied to the correct base contract / opportunity
Identify the purpose of the addon: termination management, partial supersession, LE revisions, contract drafting workflow
Check that addon fields reflect the real-world intent: for terminations (type, effective dates, catalog selection), for amendments (which clauses or fields are being changed)
Ensure status fields are accurate: Draft vs proposed vs executed vs offboarded
Validate that changes implied by the addon are reflected downstream: updated Financial terms, new or updated Schedules, Catalog changes
common_failure_modes: Addon object created but never fully wired: not linked to the right base contract, or missing catalog references
Wrong termination type (partial vs full) vs what the schedule actually lists
Changes in an addon not propagated to Financial, Schedule, Catalog, or Timeline View
Conflicting addons: multiple terminations/amendments for the same asset/territory with no clear precedence
Status left in 'Draft' even though the underlying contract has been executed

what_to_look_for: Verify effective date and term length
Confirm all party names match header
Check for amendment references
Validate territory/rights scope
Verify payment terms and rates
Look for auto-renewal clauses
Confirm termination conditions
common_failure_modes: Mismatched party names between signature block and header
Missing effective date or ambiguous term language
Unsigned or partially executed agreement
Territory scope conflicts with amendments
Rate schedules not attached or referenced incorrectly

what_to_look_for: Verify amendment references correct original agreement
Check effective date of rate change
Validate old vs new rate values
Confirm all affected catalog items listed
Verify authorized signatures
common_failure_modes: Amendment references wrong original agreement number
Rate change effective date conflicts with original term
Missing catalog items that should be affected
Unauthorized signatory

what_to_look_for: Verify new territories are clearly defined
Check if extension affects existing rate structure
Confirm effective date aligns with original term
Validate that extended territories don't conflict
common_failure_modes: Ambiguous territory definitions
Conflicts with existing territory grants
Missing rate terms for new territories

what_to_look_for: Verify all catalog items have valid identifiers
Check for duplicate entries
Validate rate/royalty values are numeric
Confirm territory assignments per item
Look for items with missing metadata
common_failure_modes: Duplicate catalog item entries with different rates
Missing or invalid item identifiers
Non-numeric values in rate columns
Items assigned to territories not in the agreement

what_to_look_for: Verify document completeness and page count
Confirm all required sections are present
Check for proper execution and dating
Validate party information consistency
Review key commercial terms
common_failure_modes: Missing pages or sections
Inconsistent party names
Missing execution dates

what_to_look_for: Verify record completeness
Check for data consistency across fields
Validate required fields are populated
Look for formatting or encoding issues
Confirm field values match expected formats
common_failure_modes: Missing required field values
Inconsistent data formats
Encoding artifacts (mojibake)
Misaligned data from source extraction
